isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 5.2 PRO-LINK 9000 ELECTRONIC SERVICE TOOL OPERATION - DESCRIPTION - WIGGLE TEST

svcproc.title: WIGGLE TEST
svcproc.para: "WIGGLE TEST" is available under the Diagnostic Test Menu. The wiggle test is to assist the technician in finding an intermittent condition. The wiggle test will monitor both signal outputs and inputs on a continuous basis. Any interruption in the circuit will cause a fault.

To access "WIGGLE TEST" from the Diagnostic Test Menu, press the "↓" key until "WIGGLE TEST" is displayed on the screen. Press the "ENTER" key, to start the test ( Figure 5.31
).

At any time during the Wiggle Test if an open or short is detected, the EST will beep and the word "BEEP" will display on the screen ( Figure 5.32
).

figure.caption: Figure 5.32 - Pro-link Wiggle Test Running Screen

svcproc.para: While in the Wiggle mode, the technician can move and wiggle the wiring harness and connectors to locate the problem.

To end the test press the "FUNC" key. The message will ask "STOP THIS TEST" press the "←" key to select yes. This will end the test ( Figure 5.33
).

figure.caption: Figure 5.33 - Pro-link Wiggle Test Stop Screen

svcproc.para: If any faults were detected, press the "ENTER" key to display the fault.
